result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Neng Yang was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $600 plus costs. To be paid based upon a schedule arranged between the defendant and the agent.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay $26.45 for the Blood Draw fee.
Obtain and maintain full time employment or full time school or combination of both to equal full time.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming alcoholic beverages.

Comply with all assessments, treatments, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign all releases of information forms pertaining to offender's treatment.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Court will allow early discharge after 24 months, if agent recommends.

timeConds.notes:
First 45 days be in jail. 
Remainder may be on home detention.
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.
Huber granted for work and medical care.

Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Neng Yang in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF204, 14CF346, 14CF439, 14TR2066

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  14CF204 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Defendant agrees this will result in her 4th offense. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF204 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF204 Count 2 is dismissed. 
14CF204 Count 3, 14CF439, 14CF346 and 14TR2066 are dismissed and read-in. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court orders a PSI. 
Bond in 14CF439 and 14CF436 is ordered held until the disposition in 14CF204.
Bond Continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on January 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
